alert.note: Alert for Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 2:51AM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. Duck River At Columbia affecting Maury County. For the Duck River...including Manchester, Shelbyville, Pottsville, Milltown, Columbia, Centerville, Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Elevated river level caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Duck River At Columbia. * WHEN...From early this morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Flood waters overflow the banks and low lying areas near Columbia begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 25.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.5 feet this evening. - Action stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CST.
